00057 
00058 SgIoHelper::SgIoHelper(const std::string &summariesFile,
00059                    const std::string &summariesFileA, const std::string &summariesFileB,
00060                    const std::string &file5,
00061                    const std::string &file5Group) {
00062   f5SumGroup= NULL;
00063   f5SumTsv = NULL;
00064   if(summariesFile != "") {
00065     string label;
00066     if(summaries.open(summariesFile) != TSV_OK)
00067       Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file " + ToStr(summariesFile) + " to read.");
00068     summaries.cidx2cname(0,0,label);
00069     if(label != "probeset_id")
00070       Err::errAbort("probeset_id must be the first column in the summaries file");
00071     int numCol = summaries.getColumnCount(0);
00072     for(int cidx=1; cidx < numCol; cidx++) {
00073       string name;
00074       summaries.cidx2cname(0,cidx,name);
00075       // We need *both* sets of column names.
00076       m_ColNames.push_back(name);
00077     }
00078     
00079   } 
00080   else if(summariesFileA != "" && summariesFileB != "") {
00081     string label;
00082     if(summariesA.open(summariesFileA) != TSV_OK)
00083       Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file " + ToStr(summariesFileA) + " to read.");
00084     summariesA.cidx2cname(0,0,label);
00085     if(label != "probeset_id")
00086       Err::errAbort("probeset_id must be the first column in the summaries file");
00087     if(summariesB.open(summariesFileB) != TSV_OK)
00088       Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file " + ToStr(summariesFileB) + " to read.");
00089     summariesB.cidx2cname(0,0,label);
00090     if(label != "probeset_id")
00091       Err::errAbort("probeset_id must be the first column in the summaries file");
00092     int numCol = summariesA.getColumnCount(0);
00093     int numColB = summariesB.getColumnCount(0);
00094     if(numCol != numColB)
00095       Err::errAbort("allele A and allele B signal files do not have the same number of columns");
00096       
00097     //
00098     for(int cidx=1; cidx < numCol; cidx++) {
00099       string name;
00100       string nameB;
00101       summariesA.cidx2cname(0,cidx,name);
00102       summariesB.cidx2cname(0,cidx,nameB);
00103       if(name != nameB)
00104         Err::errAbort("Sample names do not match between allele A and B signal files.");
00105       // We need *both* sets of column names.
00106       m_ColNames.push_back(name);
00107     }
00108       
00109   } 
00110   else if(file5 != "" && file5Group != "") {
00111     int status = f5Summaries.open(file5, affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
00112     if(status != FILE5_OK) {
00113       Err::errAbort("Can't open: " + file5);
00114     }
00115     f5SumGroup = f5Summaries.openGroup(file5Group, affx::FILE5_OPEN);
00116     f5SumTsv = f5SumGroup->openTsv("summaries", affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
00117     int columnCount = f5SumTsv->getColumnCount(0);
00118     string name;
00119     for(int i = 1; i < columnCount; i++) {
00120       f5SumTsv->getColumnName(0,i,&name);
00121       m_ColNames.push_back(name);
00122     }
00123   }
00124   else {
00125     Err::errAbort("Must provide either an interleaved summary file or separate allele A and B summary files.");
00126   }
00127 }
00128 
00129 SgIoHelper::~SgIoHelper() {
00130   if(f5SumTsv != NULL) {
00131     f5SumTsv->close();
00132     Freez(f5SumTsv);
00133   }
00134   if(f5SumGroup != NULL) {
00135     f5SumGroup->close();
00136     Freez(f5SumGroup);
00137   }
00138   f5Summaries.close();
00139 }

00141 
00142 void SgIoHelper::getLine(string &label, vector<double> &vals, TsvFile &summaries, vector<string> &colNames) {
00143   vals.clear();
00144   for(int i=0; i<colNames.size(); i++) {
00145     double val;
00146     if(summaries.get(0,i+1,val)==TSV_OK)
00147       vals.push_back(val);
00148     else
00149         Err::errAbort("Unable to read column " + ToStr(i+1) + " from summaries file.");
00150   }
00151   
00152   if(summaries.get(0,0,label)!=TSV_OK)
00153     Err::errAbort("Unable ro read label from summaries file!");
00154 }
00155 
00156 void SgIoHelper::getFile5Line(string &label, vector<double> &vals, File5_Tsv *summaries, vector<string> &colNames) {
00157   vals.clear();
00158   for(int i=0; i<colNames.size(); i++) {
00159     double val;
00160     if(summaries->get(0,i+1,&val)==FILE5_OK)
00161       vals.push_back(val);
00162     else
00163       Err::errAbort("Unable to read column " + ToStr(i+1) + " from summaries file.");
00164   }
00165   
00166   if(summaries->get(0,0,&label) != FILE5_OK)
00167     Err::errAbort("Unable ro read label from summaries file!");
00168 }
00169 
00170 bool SgIoHelper::getNextMarkerTsvSingle(vector<string> &colNames, vector<double> &aVals, 
00171   vector<double> &bVals, string &probesetName) {
00172   if(summaries.nextLevel(0)==TSV_OK) {
00173     string label, alleleName;
00174     
00175     // parse the "A" allele
00176     string aProbesetName, aProbesetAllele;
00177     getLine(label, aVals, summaries, colNames);
00178     aProbesetName = label.substr(0, label.rfind('-'));
00179     alleleName = label.substr(label.rfind('-')+1, label.size());
00180     if(alleleName != "A")
00181       Err::errAbort("Expecting to see summaries for allele A first for " + aProbesetName);
00182     
00183     // parse the "B" allele
00184     if(!(summaries.nextLevel(0)==TSV_OK)) {
00185       Err::errAbort("Unable to read Allele B for probeset " + aProbesetName);
00186     }
00187     string bProbesetName, bProbesetAllele;
00188     getLine(label, bVals, summaries, colNames);
00189     bProbesetName = label.substr(0, label.rfind('-'));
00190     alleleName = label.substr(label.rfind('-')+1, label.size());
00191     if(alleleName != "B")
00192       Err::errAbort("Expecting to see summaries for allele B second for " + aProbesetName);
00193     
00194     // check that we have the right pair
00195     if(aProbesetName != bProbesetName)
00196       Err::errAbort("Allele summaries do not pair up: " + aProbesetName + " != " + bProbesetName);
00197     probesetName = aProbesetName;
00198     
00199     return true;
00200   } 
00201   return false;
00202 }
00203 
00204 bool SgIoHelper::getNextMarkerFile5(vector<string> &colNames, vector<double> &aVals, 
00205                                   vector<double> &bVals, string &probesetName) {
00206   if(f5SumTsv->nextLevel(0)==FILE5_OK) {
00207     string label, alleleName;
00208     
00209     // parse the "A" allele
00210     string aProbesetName, aProbesetAllele;
00211     getFile5Line(label, aVals, f5SumTsv, colNames);
00212     aProbesetName = label.substr(0, label.rfind('-'));
00213     alleleName = label.substr(label.rfind('-')+1, label.size());
00214     if(alleleName != "A")
00215       Err::errAbort("Expecting to see summaries for allele A first for " + aProbesetName);
00216       
00217     // parse the "B" allele
00218     if(!(f5SumTsv->nextLevel(0)==FILE5_OK)) {
00219       Err::errAbort("Unable to read Allele B for probeset " + aProbesetName);
00220     }
00221     string bProbesetName, bProbesetAllele;
00222     getFile5Line(label, bVals, f5SumTsv, colNames);
00223     bProbesetName = label.substr(0, label.rfind('-'));
00224     alleleName = label.substr(label.rfind('-')+1, label.size());
00225     if(alleleName != "B")
00226       Err::errAbort("Expecting to see summaries for allele B second for " + aProbesetName);
00227       
00228     // check that we have the right pair
00229     if(aProbesetName != bProbesetName)
00230       Err::errAbort("Allele summaries do not pair up: " + aProbesetName + " != " + bProbesetName);
00231     probesetName = aProbesetName;
00232       
00233     return true;
00234   } 
00235   return false;
00236 }
00237 
00238 bool SgIoHelper::getNextMarkerTwoTsv(vector<string> &colNames, vector<double> &aVals, 
00239                                    vector<double> &bVals, string &probesetName) {
00240   if(summariesA.nextLevel(0)!=TSV_OK)
00241     return false;
00242   if(summariesB.nextLevel(0)!=TSV_OK)
00243     return false;
00244     
00245   string labelA, labelB;
00246   getLine(labelA, aVals, summariesA, colNames);
00247   getLine(labelB, bVals, summariesB, colNames);
00248   if(labelA != labelB)
00249     Err::errAbort("Probeset mismatch between allele signal files.");
00250   probesetName = labelA;
00251   return true;
00252 }
00253 
00254 bool SgIoHelper::getNextMarker(vector<string> &colNames, vector<double> &aVals, 
00255                    vector<double> &bVals, string &probesetName) {
00256   if(summaries.is_open()) {
00257     return getNextMarkerTsvSingle(colNames, aVals, bVals, probesetName);
00258   } 
00259   else if(summariesA.is_open() && summariesB.is_open()) {
00260     return getNextMarkerTwoTsv(colNames, aVals, bVals, probesetName);
00261   }
00262   else if(f5Summaries.is_open() && f5SumTsv != NULL) {
00263     return getNextMarkerFile5(colNames, aVals, bVals, probesetName);
00264   }
00265   else {
00266     Err::errAbort("Couldn't get next marker.");
00267   }
00268   return false; // Should never get here, just for compiler
00269 }

00274 SummaryGenotypeEngine * SummaryGenotypeEngine::FromBase(BaseEngine *engine)
00275 {
00276         if (engine != NULL && engine->getEngineName() == SummaryGenotypeEngine::EngineName())
00277                 return (SummaryGenotypeEngine *)engine;
00278         return NULL;
00279 }

00289 void SummaryGenotypeEngine::defineOptions() {
00290         defineOption("p", "algo-params", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00291                 "A string specifying algo parameters. See --explain option for acceptable parameters.",
00292                 "");
00293         defineOption("", "file5-summaries", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00294                 "Interleaved Allele summaries file in file5 format with summaries in /summaries group.",
00295                 "");
00296         defineOption("s", "summaries", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00297                 "Interleaved Allele summaries file.",
00298                 "");
00299         defineOption("", "summaries-a", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00300                 "Allele summarie file for A allele.",
00301                 "");
00302         defineOption("", "summaries-b", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00303                 "Allele summarie file for B allele.",
00304                 "");
00305         defineOption("", "file5-output", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00306                 "Should output be formatted in file5 (hdf5) output.",
00307                 "false");
00308         defineOption("", "chrX-snps", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00309                 "File containing snps on chrX (non-pseudoautosomal region).",
00310                 "");
00311         defineOption("", "special-snps",PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00312                 "File containing all snps of unusual copy (chrX,mito,Y)",
00313                 "");
00314         defineOption("", "special-sample-snps",PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00315                 "File containing all sample-specific snps of unusual copy",
00316                 "");
00317         defineOption("", "write-models", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00318                 "Should we write snp specific models out for analysis? [experimental]",
00319                 "false");
00320         defineOption("", "read-models-brlmmp", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00321                 "File to read precomputed BRLMM-P snp specific models from.",
00322                 "");
00323         defineOption("", "read-genders", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00324                 "Explicitly read genders from a file.",
00325                 "");
00326         defineOption("", "genotypes", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00327                 "File to read seed genotypes from.",
00328                 "");
00329         defineOption("","select-probes",PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00330                 "Should we evaluate model fit for clusters by probe-set/probe[experimental]",
00331                 "false");
00332         defineOption("", "set-analysis-name", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00333         "Explicitly set the analysis name. This affects output file names (ie prefix) and various meta info.",
00334                 "");
00335 }

00340 /**
00341  * Make sure that our options are sane. Call Err::errAbort if not.
00342  */
00343 void SummaryGenotypeEngine::checkOptionsImp()
00344 {
00345     defineStates();
00346 
00347         setLibFileOpt("chrX-snps");
00348         setLibFileOpt("special-snps");
00349         setLibFileOpt("read-models-brlmmp");
00350 
00351         string outDir = getOpt("out-dir");
00352         if(!Fs::isWriteableDir(outDir)) {
00353           if(Fs::mkdirPath(outDir, false) != APT_OK) {
00354             APT_ERR_ABORT("Can't make or write to directory: " + ToStr(outDir));
00355           }
00356         }
00357 }
00358 
00359 /**
00360    This is the "main()" equivalent of the engine. This function has
00361    two main phases: 1) Creation an initialization of AnalysisStream
00362    and associated objects. 2) Looping through the list of cdf
00363    probesets to do the genotyping calls.
00364 
00365    Phase 2 is definitely where most of the time and cpu cycles are
00366    spent. The list of things that happens for each iteration of phase
00367    2 is:
00368    - Read in cel files only keeping data needed for current iteration in RAM.
00369    - While reading cel files make DM calls.
00370    - Once cel files are read loop through probesets making BRLMM genotype
00371    calls.
00372 
00373    Special things that happen in the first iteration of phase 2:
00374    - Calculate prior if desired.
00375    - Determine gender using DM calls if desired.
00376    - Learn chipstream parameters necessary.
00377    - Attach any reporters to the analysis streams.
00378 
00379    Top of the call stack... This function is getting to be a real
00380    beast, time for some refactoring...
00381 */
00382 void SummaryGenotypeEngine::runImp()
00383 {
00384     // dummy stuff needed to spoof full analysis stream
00385     ChipLayout layout; 
00386     std::vector<probeidx_t> analysisOrder;
00387     std::vector<ChipStream *> iTrans;
00388     PmOnlyAdjust pmAdjust;
00389     ProbeSetGroup psGroup;
00390 
00391         string outDir = getOpt("out-dir");
00392         Util::chompLastIfSep(outDir);
00393         string summariesFile = getOpt("summaries");
00394         string summariesFileA = getOpt("summaries-a");
00395         string summariesFileB = getOpt("summaries-b");
00396         string quantMethod = "brlmm-p";
00397         string algoParams = getOpt("algo-params");
00398         bool selectProbes = getOptBool("select-probes");
00399         string specialSnpsFile = getOpt("special-snps");
00400         string specialSampleSnpsFile = getOpt("special-sample-snps");
00401         string chrXSnps = getOpt("chrX-snps");
00402         string readModelsBrlmmp=getOpt("read-models-brlmmp");
00403         bool writeModels = getOptBool("write-models");
00404         string genderFileIn = getOpt("read-genders");
00405         string genoTypesFile = getOpt("genotypes");
00406         string filePrefix = getOpt("set-analysis-name");
00407         if (filePrefix.empty() == true)
00408                 filePrefix = quantMethod;
00409 
00410     // open up summaries file for input
00411     vector<string> colNames;
00412     string summaryFile = getOpt("summaries");
00413     string summaryAFile = getOpt("summaries-a");
00414     string summaryBFile = getOpt("summaries-b");
00415     string summaryA5File = getOpt("file5-summaries");
00416     SgIoHelper ioHelp(summaryFile, summaryAFile, summaryBFile, summaryA5File, "/");
00417     colNames = ioHelp.getColNames();
00418 
00419     // Setup dummy sparse mart to spoof the quant method
00420     SparseMart iMart(analysisOrder, colNames, false);
00421 
00422     // Create Quant Method
00423     string analysis = quantMethod;
00424     if(algoParams != "") {
00425         analysis += "." + algoParams;
00426     }
00427     QuantMethodFactory quantMethodFactory(QuantMethodFactory::GenoType);
00428     Verbose::out(1,"Creating QuantMethod for genotyping from: " + analysis);
00429     QuantGTypeMethod *qMethod = 
00430         quantMethodFactory.quantGTypeMethodForString(analysis, layout, QuantMethodFactory::GenoType);
00431     QuantLabelZ *qBrlmmp = dynamic_cast<QuantLabelZ *>(qMethod);
00432 
00433     // Create Report
00434     QuantMethodGTypeReport *report = new QuantMethodGTypeReport();
00435     report->setDirPath(outDir);
00436     report->setFileprefix(filePrefix);
00437     report->setFilename("QuantMethodGTypeReport-A5"); // for debugging
00438     if(getOptBool("file5-output")) {
00439       report->setCompactFile5Format(20);
00440     }
00441     else {
00442       report->setFormat(affx::TsvReport::FMT_TSV);
00443       report->setPrecision(5);
00444     }
00445     //    report->setFilename("QuantMethodGTypeReport-TXT"); // for debugging
00446     //    report->setFormat(affx::TsvReport::FMT_A5);
00447 
00448     //
00449 
00450     //
00451     string qMethodGuid = affxutil::Guid::GenerateNewGuid();
00452     string execGuid = affxutil::Guid::GenerateNewGuid();
00453     string timeStr = ""; ///@todo set time string
00454     string commandLine = ""; ///@todo set command line string
00455     string execVersion = ""; ///@todo set command line string
00456     AnalysisInfo info; ///@todo populate analysis info object
00457     //
00458     report->addStdHeaders((QuantMethodReport *)report, 
00459                           execGuid,
00460                           qMethodGuid,
00461                           timeStr,
00462                           commandLine, 
00463                           execVersion,
00464                           info);
00465 
00466     report->prepare(*qMethod, iMart);
00467     
00468     // setup special SNPs
00469     SpecialSnpMap specialSnps;
00470     map<string,bool> haploidSnps;
00471     if(specialSnpsFile != "") {
00472         string chip, specialType;
00473         readSpecialSnpsFile(&specialSnps, &chip, &specialType, specialSnpsFile);
00474         haploidFromSpecial(specialSnps,haploidSnps);
00475     } else if(chrXSnps != "") {
00476         fillInHaploidSnps(chrXSnps, haploidSnps, NULL, true);
00477         specialFromHaploid(specialSnps, haploidSnps);
00478     }
00479 
00480     if(!specialSnps.empty())
00481         qBrlmmp->setSpecialSnps(specialSnps);
00482     else if(!haploidSnps.empty())
00483         qBrlmmp->setHaploidSnps(haploidSnps);
00484 
00485     SpecialSampleSnpMap specialSampleSnps;
00486     SpecialSampleNameVector specialSampleNames;
00487     if(specialSampleSnpsFile != "") {
00488         string chip, specialType;
00489         readSpecialSampleSnpsFile(&specialSampleSnps, &specialSampleNames,
00490                         specialSampleSnpsFile);
00491     }
00492 
00493     if(!specialSampleSnps.empty())
00494         qBrlmmp->setSpecialSampleSnps(specialSampleSnps, specialSampleNames);
00495 
00496     // setup genders
00497     vector<Gender> genders;
00498     if(genderFileIn != "") {
00499         FileGenders genderReader(genderFileIn,colNames);
00500         genders = genderReader.getGenders();
00501     } else {
00502         for(int i = 0; i < colNames.size(); i++)
00503             genders.push_back(UnknownGender);
00504     }
00505     qBrlmmp->setGenders(genders);
00506 
00507     // read in SNP models
00508     if(readModelsBrlmmp!="")
00509         qBrlmmp->readSnpPriorMap(readModelsBrlmmp.c_str());
00510 
00511     // write SNP models?
00512     if(writeModels) {
00513       string outfile = Fs::join(outDir,filePrefix + ".snp-posteriors");
00514       qBrlmmp->writeSnpPosteriorTsv(outfile,affx::TsvReport::FMT_TSV);
00515     }
00516 
00517 
00518         if (selectProbes)
00519       {
00520         string outfile = Fs::join(outDir,filePrefix + ".select-probes.txt");
00521           qBrlmmp->writeSnpProbeTsv(outfile,affx::TsvReport::FMT_TSV);
00522       }
00523         
00524 
00525     // read in seed genotypes
00526     std::map<const char *,std::vector<affx::GType>, Util::ltstr > knownGenotypes;
00527     if(!genoTypesFile.empty()) {
00528       std::vector<std::string> probesets;
00529       GenoSeedTxt seeds(genoTypesFile.c_str(), layout, colNames, haploidSnps);
00530       seeds.fillProbesets(probesets);
00531 
00532       for(int i=0; i<probesets.size(); i++) {
00533         const char *name = Util::cloneString(probesets[i].c_str());
00534         vector<GType> callVec = seeds.getGenoCalls(name);
00535         knownGenotypes[name] = callVec;
00536       }
00537       qBrlmmp->setKnownGenoTypes(&knownGenotypes);
00538     }
00539 
00540     // for each SNP -- two rows in summaries file
00541     Verbose::out(1,"Making calls...");
00542     vector<double> aVals,bVals;
00543 
00544     string probesetName;
00545     while(ioHelp.getNextMarker( colNames, aVals, bVals, probesetName)) {
00546 
00547         // set probeset name for report
00548         qBrlmmp->setProbeSetName(probesetName);
00549 
00550         // fill in allele values
00551         qBrlmmp->setAlleleValues(aVals,bVals);
00552     
00553         // transform the data as specified
00554         qBrlmmp->transform();
00555    
00556         // load up seed genotypes
00557         qBrlmmp->loadInitialCallsForSnp(probesetName);
00558 
00559         // make the call
00560         qBrlmmp->computeEstimate();
00561     
00562         // report results
00563         report->report(psGroup, *qMethod, iMart, iTrans, pmAdjust);
00564     }
00565     Verbose::out(1,"Done.");
00566 
00567     report->finish(*qMethod);
00568     // clean up
00569     delete qBrlmmp;
00570     delete report;
00571 }
